title: Fast LD Estimation
text: demonstrate new moment-based linkage disequilibrium (LD) estimators, implemented ldfast() function. methods described detail Gerard (2021). following code chunks evaluated updog installed version least 2.0.2.

title: Fast LD Estimation
text: load packages data need need posterior probabilities genotype individual SNP. updog, corresponds Pr_n variables output, n varies 0 ploidy. can use updog::format_multidog() extract values array proper dimensions. first dimension indexes SNPs, second dimension indexes individuals, third dimension indexes possible dosages. gp[, j, k] contains posterior probability individual j dosage k-1 SNP . can use genotyping programs obtain posterior probabilities, formatted array dimensions correct order (SNPs individuals dosages). However, order estimates perform well, need use posterior genotype probabilities calculated using adaptive priors, .e. empirical/hierarchical Bayes approaches. many approaches , {updog}, {polyRAD}, {fitPoly}, {SuperMASSA}. Note GATK uses uniform prior, inappropriate use ldfast(). Let’s use genotype posterior probabilities (gp) estimate LD. ldout contains: ldmat: estimated squared correlation coefficients, adjusted genotype uncertainty.  semat: estimated standard errors squared correlation coefficient estimates.  rr: estimated “reliability ratios”, multiplicative effects applied naive LD estimates using just posterior mean genotypes.  slowest part ldfast() using hierarchical shrinkage log reliability ratios (shrinkrr = TRUE), wouldn’t disable reliability ratios high variance greatly improved shrinkage. LD estimators available: D, Dprime, r, z. See help file ldfast() details.
code: library(updog) library(ldsep) library(corrplot) #> corrplot 0.95 loaded data("uit", package = "ldsep") class(uit) #> [1] "multidog" ploidy <- 4 gp <- format_multidog(x = uit, varname = paste0("Pr_", 0:ploidy)) class(gp) #> [1] "array" dim(gp) #> [1] 10 84  5 ldout <- ldfast(gp = gp, type = "r2") corrplot(corr = ldout$ldmat,           method = "color",           type = "upper",          diag = FALSE,          tl.pos = "n") corrplot(corr = ldout$semat,           method = "color",           type = "upper",          diag = FALSE,          tl.pos = "n",           is.corr = FALSE) graphics::hist(x = ldout$rr,                 main = "Reliability Ratios",                 xlab = "Reliability Ratios")

title: Fast LD Estimation
text: Gerard, David (2021). “Scalable Bias-corrected Linkage Disequilibrium Estimation Genotype Uncertainty.” Heredity, 127(4), 357–362. doi:10.1038/s41437-021-00462-5.

title: LD Estimation Pipeline from VCF
text: vignette covers Load read-count data VCF file R using VariantAnnotation, Format data genotyping using updog, Format updog output LD estimation using ldsep, Estimate LD using ldsep formatted output. need following packages: packages installed, can install R using: following code chunks evaluated packages installed. particular, need make sure version updog least 2.0.2.
code: library(VariantAnnotation) library(updog) library(ldsep) install.packages(c("ldsep", "updog", "BiocManager")) BiocManager::install("VariantAnnotation") packageVersion("updog") #> [1] '2.1.5'

what: Extract data from a VCF file using VariantAnnotation
title: LD Estimation Pipeline from VCF
text: ldsep package comes VCF file containing small (arbitrarily chosen) subset data Uitdewilligen et. al. (2013). data consist diversity panel autotetraploid Solanum tuberosum (2n = 4x = 48). location file computer can found : use excellent VariantAnnotation package (Obenchain et. al., 2014) load data R. can read VariantAnnotation vignette: https://doi.org/doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.VariantAnnotation brief description genotype fields can seen See Samtools website detailed description format genotype fields VCF file: http://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/ format data genotyping updog, need total read-depth, VCF file DP field, need read-depth reference allele, VCF file RA field. read VCF documentation (documentation software created VCF) carefully, might need work genotype fields obtain read-counts. example, many VCF files need work AD field contains read-depth allele. matrices rows index loci columns index individuals. , sizemat[, j] total read-count SNP individual j, refmat[, j] reference read-count SNP individual j.
code: uit_file <- system.file("extdata", "subuit.vcf",                          package = "ldsep",                         mustWork = TRUE) subuit <- readVcf(file = uit_file) class(subuit) #> [1] "CollapsedVCF" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "VariantAnnotation" geno(header(subuit)) #> DataFrame with 8 rows and 3 columns #>         Number        Type            Description #>    <character> <character>            <character> #> GT           1      String               Genotype #> GQ           1     Integer Genotype Quality, th.. #> GL           G       Float Genotype Likelihood,.. #> DP           1     Integer             Read Depth #> RA           1     Integer Reference allele obs.. #> AA           1     Integer Alternate allele obs.. #> SR           1     Integer Number of reference .. #> SA           1     Integer Number of alternate .. sizemat <- geno(subuit)$DP refmat <- geno(subuit)$RA

title: LD Estimation Pipeline from VCF
text: genotype individuals, use multidog() function updog R package (Gerard et. al., 2018; Gerard Ferrão, 2020). use genotyping programs, long return genotype log-likelihoods. use model = "norm". can plot SNPs genotype plot (Gerard et. al., 2018) evaluate accuracy genotyping:  probably want filter SNPs mostly monoallelic. can filter_snp(). can obtain genotype log-likelihoods, appropriate format used ldesp, format_multidog(). three-way array genotype log-likelihoods. first dimension indexes SNPs, second dimension indexes individuals, third dimension indexes genotypes. , larray[, j, k] genotype log-likelihood SNP individual j dosage k - 1. possible also just use posterior means LD estimation (result speed gains loss accuracy). can extract posterior means also using format_multidog(). matrix posterior mean genotypes. , pmmat[, j] posterior mean genotype SNP individual j.
code: ploidy <- 4 mout <- multidog(refmat = refmat,                   sizemat = sizemat,                   ploidy = ploidy,                   model = "norm") #>     |                                   *.#,%     #>    |||                                 *******/   #>  |||||||    (**..#**.                  */   **/   #> |||||||||    */****************************/*%    #>    |||    &****..,*.************************/     #>    |||     (....,,,*,...****%********/(******     #>    |||                ,,****%////,,,,./.****/     #>    |||                  /**//         .*///....   #>    |||                  .*/*/%#         .,/   .,  #>    |||               , **/   #%         .*    ..  #>    |||                               ,,,*         #>  #> Working on it...done! plot(mout, indices = c(1, 14, 19)) msub <- filter_snp(x = mout, pmax(Pr_0, Pr_1, Pr_2, Pr_3, Pr_4) < 0.95) nrow(msub$snpdf) #> [1] 10 varnames <- paste0("logL_", 0:ploidy) varnames #> [1] "logL_0" "logL_1" "logL_2" "logL_3" "logL_4" larray <- format_multidog(x = msub, varname = varnames) class(larray) #> [1] "array" dim(larray) #> [1] 10 84  5 pmmat <- format_multidog(x = msub, varname = "postmean") class(pmmat) #> [1] "matrix" "array" dim(pmmat) #> [1] 10 84

title: LD Estimation Pipeline from VCF
text: also demonstrate use genotyping program, fitPoly (Voorrips et. al., 2011; Zych et. al., 2019), obtain genotype log-likelihoods. None code chunks run default want include dependencies just used vignette. can run code chunks manually. Makes sure fitPoly reshape2 packages installed: first need format VCF data appropriately use fitPoly. created two files working directory: uit_scores.RData: contains information sample. “RData” file contains data frame called scores. uit_models.RData: contains information SNP. “RData” file contains data frame called modeldata. ’ll load data frames R now. filter SNPs monoallelic: fitPoly provides posterior genotype probabilities (scores data frame), genotype likelihoods. can divide posterior probabilities provided prior probabilities (modeldata data frame) use genotype likelihoods. aren’t quite genotype likelihoods, proportional constant depend parameters, result MLEs using real genotype likelihoods. create little bit work us, formatting-wise, however. can now, choose, use fp_llarray instead larray follows. , fp_llarray[, j, k] genotype log-likelihood SNP individual j dosage k - 1. Note sequencing data, updog generally perform better fitPoly, fitPoly designed microarray data. microarray data, fitPoly works really well.
code: # install.packages(c("fitPoly", "reshape2")) library(fitPoly) library(reshape2) ratiodf <- melt(data = refmat / sizemat,                  varnames = c("MarkerName", "SampleName"),                  value.name = "ratio") saveMarkerModels(ploidy = ploidy,                   data = ratiodf,                   filePrefix = "uit",                  rdaFiles = TRUE) load("./uit_scores.RData") load("./uit_models.RData") modeldata <- subset(x = modeldata, subset = pmax(P0, P1, P2, P3, P4) < 0.95) scores <- scores[scores$MarkerName %in% modeldata$MarkerName, ] mergedf <- merge(x = scores[c("MarkerName", "SampleName", paste0("P", 0:ploidy))],                   y = modeldata[c("MarkerName", paste0("P", 0:ploidy))],                   by = "MarkerName",                   all.x = TRUE) for (i in 0:ploidy) {   current_post <- paste0("P", i, ".x")   current_prior <- paste0("P", i, ".y")     current_ll <- paste0("logL_", i)   mergedf[[current_ll]] <- log(mergedf[[current_post]]) - log(mergedf[[current_prior]]) }  fp_llarray <- acast(   melt(data = mergedf[c("MarkerName", "SampleName", paste0("logL_", 0:ploidy))],        id.vars = c("MarkerName", "SampleName"),         variable.name = "dosage",         value.name = "logl"),   formula = "MarkerName ~ SampleName ~ dosage",    value.var = "logl", )

title: LD Estimation Pipeline from VCF
text: now demonstrate estimate LD using ldsep package (Gerard, 2021). estimate LD using maximum likelihood, directly genotype log-likelihoods, use mldest() array genotype log-likelihoods. can visualize LD estimates using plot()  naive LD estimates (using just sample moments) posterior mean can also found using mldest(): larger naive LD estimates noticeably attenuated toward zero (due influence genotype uncertainty).  easier see attenuation scatterplot. red, dashed line y=x line points line pairs SNPs LD estimated larger MLE method compared naive method. larger LD values much attenuated using naive approach.  Finally, LD estimates may obtained matrix form using format_lddf().
code: like_ld <- mldest(geno = larray, K = ploidy, type = "comp") plot(like_ld) mom_ld <- mldest(geno = pmmat, K = ploidy, type = "comp") plot(mom_ld) par(mar = c(2.4, 2.8, 0, 0) + 0.5, mgp = c(1.8, 0.6, 0)) plot(mom_ld$r2, like_ld$r2,       xlab = expression(paste(textstyle(Naive), ~~hat(r)^2)),       ylab = expression(paste(textstyle(MLE), ~~hat(r)^2)),       pch  = 20) abline(0, 1, lty = 2, col = 2) ldmat <- format_lddf(obj = like_ld, element = "r2") ldmat[1:4, 1:4] #>               PotVar0070390 PotVar0070392 PotVar0070393 PotVar0070394 #> PotVar0070390            NA    0.01382096    0.01314104    0.52714816 #> PotVar0070392            NA            NA    0.45734767    0.03634504 #> PotVar0070393            NA            NA            NA    0.05895799 #> PotVar0070394            NA            NA            NA            NA

what: Linkage Disequilibrium Shrinkage Estimation for Polyploids
title: Linkage Disequilibrium Shrinkage Estimation for Polyploids
text: Estimate haplotypic composite pairwise linkage disequilibrium (LD) polyploids, using either genotypes genotype likelihoods. Support provided estimate popular measures LD: LD coefficient DD, standardized LD coefficient D′D', Pearson correlation coefficient rr. estimates returned corresponding standard errors. estimates standard errors can used shrinkage estimation. methods described Gerard (2021a) Gerard (2021b). main functions : ldfast(): Fast, moment-based approach estimate pairwise LD presence genotype uncertainty. ldest(): Estimates pairwise LD via maximum likelihood. mldest(): Iteratively apply ldest() across many pairs SNPs. sldest(): Iteratively apply ldest() along sliding window fixed length. plot.lddf(): Plot method output mldest() sldest(). format_lddf(): Format output mldest() sldest() matrix. ldshrink(): Shrink correlation estimates using adaptive shrinkage (Stephens, 2017; Dey Stephens, 2018).

D: pAB - pA pB D': D / Dmax, Dmax = min(pA pB, (1 - pA) (1 - pB)) D < 0 Dmax = min(pA (1 - pB), pA (1 - pB)) D > 0 r-squared: squared Pearson correlation, r^2 = D^2 / (pA (1 - pA) pB (1 - pB)) r: Pearson correlation, r = D / sqrt(pA (1 - pA) pB (1 - pB)) Estimates obtained via maximum likelihood assumption Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium. likelihood calculated integrating possible haplotypes pair genotypes. resulting standard errors based square roots inverse negative Fisher-information. standard maximum likelihood theory. title: Fast bias-correction for LD Estimation — ldfast
text: Returns consistent bias-corrected estimates linkage disequilibrium. usual measures LD implemented: D, D', r, r2, z (Fisher-z r). composite measures LD, haplotypic measures LD (see description ldest()). always appropriate measures association loci, correspond haplotypic measures LD Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium fulfilled autopolyploids. order estimates perform well, need use posterior genotype probabilities calculated using adaptive priors, .e. empirical/hierarchical Bayes approaches. many approaches , updog, polyRAD, fitPoly, SuperMASSA. Note GATK uses uniform prior, inappropriate use ldfast(). Calculating standard errors performing hierarchical shrinkage reliability ratios rather slow operations compared just raw method--moments based estimation LD. need standard errors, can double speed setting se = FALSE. recommended disable hierarchical shrinkage. Due sampling variability, estimates sometime lie outside theoretical boundaries parameters estimated. cases, truncate estimates boundary return NA standard errors.

title: Fast bias-correction for LD Estimation — ldfast
text: Let \(r\) sample correlation posterior mean genotypes loci 1 2, \(a1\) sample variance posterior means locus 1, \(a2\) sample variance posterior means locus 2, \(b1\) sample mean posterior variances locus 1, \(b2\) sample mean posterior variances locus 2. estimated Pearson correlation genotypes loci 1 2 $$\sqrt{(a1 + b1)/a1}\sqrt{(a2 + b2)/a2}r.$$ LD calculations based equation. particular, estimated genotype variances loci 1 2 \(a1 + b1\) \(a2 + b2\), respectively, can used calculate D D'. reliability ratio SNP defined \((ai + bi)/ai\). default, apply ash() (Stephens, 2016) log reliability ratios adjusting Pearson correlation. Standard errors required using ash(), easily obtained using central limit theorem delta-method.

title: Estimate all pair-wise LD's in a collection of SNPs using genotypes or genotype likelihoods. — mldest
text: geno One two possible inputs: matrix genotypes (allele dosages). rows index SNPs columns index individuals. , genomat[, j] allele dosage individual j SNP . type = "comp", dosages allowed continuous (e.g. posterior mean genotypes). three-way array genotype log-likelihoods. first dimension indexes SNPs, second dimension indexes individuals, third dimension indexes genotypes. , genolike_array[, j, k] genotype log-likelihood SNP individual j dosage k - 1. K ploidy species. Assumed individuals. nc number computing cores use. never number cores available computing environment. can determine maximum number available cores running parallel::detectCores() R. probably fine personal computer, environments able use fewer. Ask admins unsure. type type LD calculate. available types haplotypic LD (type = "hap") composite LD (type = "comp"). Haplotypic LD appropriate autopolyploids individuals Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium (HWE). composite measures LD always applicable, consistently estimate usual measures LD HWE fulfilled autopolyploids. However, HWE fulfilled, interpreting composite measures LD little tricky. model type = "comp" using genotype likelihoods, use proportional bivariate normal model estimate genotype distribution (model = "norm"), general categorical distribution (model = "flex")? Defaults "norm". pen penalty applied likelihood. can think prior sample size. greater 1. apply model = "norm", type = "comp", using genotype likelihoods. Also apply type = "comp" using genotypes. se logical. calculate standard errors (TRUE) (FALSE). Calculating standard errors can really slow type = "comp", model = "flex", using genotype likelihoods. Otherwise, standard error calculations pretty fast.
